info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:35PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pondera and southeastern Glacier Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 334 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Heart Butte, or 20 miles southwest of Cut Bank, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Pondera and southeastern Glacier Counties. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 246 and 252. Highway 89 between mile markers 89 and 102. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
